sen.j: 『類聚三代格』によると、809年（大同 (日本)4年）3月21日 (旧暦)の太政官符に雅楽寮、雑楽師が定められた。
sen.e: According to Ruiju sandaikyaku (statute book written in the Heian Period), gagakuryo (a government official in the ritsuryo codes, who administer gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) and gakunin (player)) and zatsugakushi (a musician of various music other than gagaku) were established in Daijokanpu (official documents from Daijokan to local governments) issued on May 23, 809 (April 21, 808 in old lunar calendar).

sen.e: Daijokanpu issued on October 26, 848 (September 22, 848 in old lunar calendar) describes to narrow definitions of gagakuryo and Zoshiki no sho.

sen.e: Daijokanpu issued on October 26, 848 describes that gagakuryo and zoshiki no sho (student of low level functionaries) should be decreased.
